techmeme.title: Sources: Trump's transition team is considering Dan Gallagher, an ex-SEC commissioner and Robinhood's current legal chief, as SEC chair replacing Gary Gensler (Reuters)
Detroit plans to accept crypto, including BTC and ETH, for tax and fee payments starting mid-2025 via a PayPal-managed platform, the largest US city to do so (Sebastian Sinclair/Decrypt)
A US judge dismisses Ethan Zuckerman's lawsuit against Meta; Zuckerman sought to stop Meta from suing him over a tool to let users unfollow everyone on Facebook (David McCabe/New York Times)
Yelp agrees to buy RepairPal, a site for car repair estimates, for $80M in cash, with the deal expected to close by the end of 2024; RepairPal had raised $21.3M (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Source: Baidu plans to unveil smart glasses with built-in cameras and voice support for AI model Ernie next week, launching as soon as early 2025 for under $299 (Bloomberg)
